title: Ibrahim Abdullahi
text:
Hello,
I am Ibrahim Abdullahi, a graduate student of the department of Economics at Memorial University of Newfoundland and Labrador (MUN) and a research Assistant to Dr. Mustapha Immurana (Senior Research Fellow at University of Health and Allied Sciences). I also serve as a Graduate Teaching Assistant at Department of Economics MUN. I have keen interest in Econometrics, Economics Theory , Insurance & Risks, Data Analytics, Machine learning and Causal inference. My research span from Health economics, Labor Economics, Energy Economics, Environmental Economics and a long- standing casual inferences

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Professional Summary
Passionate Economics Master’s student skilled in translating economic theories into practical solutions through analytical thinking and quantitative methods. I have a robust foundation in economic modeling, statistical analysis, and empirical research, allowing me to apply theoretical knowledge to real-world economic challenges. I am currently a Research Assistant to Dr. MUstapha Immurana (Senior Research Fellow at University of Health and Allied Sciences (UHAS)) and a Graduate Teaching Assistant at Memorial University of Newfoundland and Labrador(MUN). I have a long standing experience in teachinf. Eager to contribute my academic rigor and analytical expertise to dynamic research or policy-oriented roles in the field of economics.
